Technique: DOVETAIL (JOINT); WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Greek papyrus
Description: This papyrus fragment (P.Hib. I 100), which dates from the reign of Ptolomy Philadelphus, presents Greek texts written on the two sides. On the one (the recto?) we find an account of cereals and on the other (the verso?) a receipt for taxes on barley.
